byline.contributor: Reporting was contributed by Michael M. Grynbaum, Elizabeth A. Harris, Mireya Navarro and Kate Taylor from New York.
byline.original: By THOMAS KAPLAN and JESSE McKINLEY

abstract: New York Gov Andrew M Cuomo and state legislators agree to several stop-gap measures on unresolved issues; reach tentative deal extending rent regulations in New York City, as well as 421-a tax incentive program for affordable housing and mayoral control of New York City schools; Cuomo says he may act unilaterally on some controversial matters.
lead_paragraph: The deal in Albany came in a legislative session that has dragged nearly a week past its scheduled end.

headline.main: Tentative Deal in Albany Would Extend Rent Laws; Key Issues Are Unresolved
headline.print_headline: Tentative Deal in Albany Would Extend Rent Laws; Key Issues Are Unresolved

snippet: The deal in Albany came in a legislative session that has dragged nearly a week past its scheduled end.
